roleset.name: make seem greater

example.name: agentive transitive
example.text: Courtaulds-1 has been under pressure *trace*-1 to enhance shareholder value since takeover speculators -- including Australian financier Kerry Packer -- surfaced holding small stakes last year.

example.name: instrumental subject
example.text: In a statement, Arnold B. McKinnon, chairman and chief executive officer, noted that [the new repurchase program]-1 ``should serve *trace*-1 to enhance shareholder value.''

example.name: passivized instrumental subject
example.text: [The quarter-to-quarter comparison]-1 was also enhanced *trace*-1 by charges taken in the year-earlier period, including $11 million related to the modernization of a pulp and newsprint mill in Alabama.
example.arg: by charges taken in the year-earlier period, including $11 million related to the modernization of a pulp and newsprint mill in Alabama.

example.name: with extent PP
example.text: The company estimated that the transaction would enhance its book value by more than $100 million.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: It implies that good swimming athletes coming from five continents and four oceans assembled together in Rome to strengthen understanding and enhance friendship through competition .
example.arg: good swimming athletes coming from five continents and four oceans

roleset.note: ENHANCE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'enhance' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. No comparison. (from enhance.01-v predicate notes)
ENHANCING-J NOTES: Based on Thyme data. Comparison to enhance.01-v. (from enhancing.01-j)
